newsitem.title: GERMANY: German police grab hostage-taker in jail hospital.
newsitem.headline: German police grab hostage-taker in jail hospital.

text.p: German police stormed a prison hospital in the eastern town of Naumburg on Sunday to free a prison worker who had been taken hostage on Saturday by an inmate, police said.
Authorities said neither the 43-year-old employee who had been taken hostage nor the inmate were injured in a raid launched by 30 police commandos.

The police blasted open a door with an explosive device and rushed into the hospital room. After a brief struggle they overwhelmed the hostage-taker, a 37-year-old man convicted in 1995 of attempted murder and not eligible for parole until 2002.

The hostage-taker had requested his case be reopened, police said. The prison worker was taken hostage on Saturday afternoon when the inmate pulled out a sharp object and forced the worker into the prison hospital with him.
Naumburg is about 160 km (100 miles) south of Berlin. The prison in Naumburg holds 300 prisoners and is the largest in the eastern state of Saxony-Anhalt.
